title: Arrays
content:
Overview# Arrays are one of the simplest data structures.
Core Idea# Elements are stored in contiguous memory locations.
Complexity Analysis# Access: \( O(1) \) Search: O(n) Code snippet# int arr[5] = {1,2,3,4,5}; int arr[] = {1, 2, 3}; arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] let arr : [i32; 5] = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]; Core Idea# Elements are stored in contiguous memory locations.
Complexity Analysis# Access: \( O(1) \) Search: O(n) Code snippet# int arr[5] = {1,2,3,4,5}; int arr[] = {1, 2, 3}; arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] let arr : [i32; 5] = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5];

title: Binary Search
content:
Overview# Binary search divides the search space in half repeatedly.
Complexity Analysis# Time: O(log n) Space: O(1)

title: Linked Lists
content: Overview# Linked lists store elements non-contiguously.
